page.title: 07EASINGTON SCHOOL AND PUPILS
page.content: {ESTABLISHMENT}A National School opened here in 1857.It became C.of E. in 1908.We were extended in 1954 and a 30 place Nursery was added in 1976. {PRESENT DAY.}In July 1985 there are 4 classes with 121 children and with 45 on on rolepart in the Nursery. Numbers of children are rising due to the Gas Terminal expansion and to unemployed people coming to live by the sea. {NEW SCHOOL.}This is planned due to rising numbers and the proximity of the Gas Terminals. {POSITION.}We are the most Eastern School in Humberside, and are about half a mile from the beach,to which there is easy access {STAFF.}There are 6 full time teachers and 1 part time.There are 3 kitchen staff,1 secretary,1 caretaker,1 cleaner,2 supervisors and a stoker/gardener.
